descriptionHtml:
A Realistic Hope ([url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9936]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9936[/url]) - Fix for dark Nights + Interiors

The original Realistic Hope used a palette texture that merged the darkest light ranges to black, causing the night adaptation and any other dark/night lighting edits to fail.

I\'ve seen it a loooot over the years with ENB.  If I had to coin a phrase for the phenomenon, I\'d call it \'palette compression\'.

My version includes re-worked lighting to simulate the removed palette.  It\'s not perfect, and I may re-visit this at a later date to get it closer to the original.

[center]________________________________________________________[/center]
[b][size=5]TL;DR[/size]
[u]Zuh?  Why no Palette?[/b][/u]
Palettes allow for finer control over specific color and tone ranges than their ENB ini counterparts, which are not specific to color ranges.  The RH palette pushed low-brightness colors to black too quickly, compressing the dynamic range and making dark areas drop to black for the most part.

Palettes also [b]remove[/b] the ability to use color correction controls, and (sometimes) causes day and night detection to break completely, leaving 1 set of controls (night) to apply to ALL scenes, regardless of time or brightness.

Hence, there is no way to fix this while still using the palette.
